climbs.name: Stumpjumper
climbs.fa: Neal Newcomb, Tim Noonan, Grant Hiskes (1985)

content.description: Climb the first 25 feet or so of H&R Block, then break left out a corner and through the first roof. Clip a bolt with a shoulder length runner, make some balancy moves standing up under a  second roof. Reach over the lip to get a rather small sidepull/pinch and make a strenuous move reaching to better holds. Clip a second bolt, step over the roof and climb easy terrain past a 3rd bolt to the top. The gear anchor takes between .75 to 3" gear.
content.location: Center of the cliff, more or less.

content.description: Thin crack in a right facing dihedral.  As you near the top, stay in the dihedral, which curves to the right.
content.protection: Gear to 1" for route; build a gear anchor.
content.location:
This is the next crack left of the start of Stumpjumper/H & R Block.

Walk left to get of or find the rap anchors towards the left end of the cliff.

content.description: To the left of "Curly Shuffle", climb blocks and a crack, passing a block, about halfway up.

A lieback in a dihedral straight off the ground is the crux. Follow the dihedral to a broken section which is climbed up and right to the long diagonal crack below a huge roof. Follow the crack up and right to the top.
content.location:
Find the largest diagonal roof on the cliff and then pick the easiest line up to it. This is Forest Service.

To descend, either walk off to the left or walk right to the rap anchor right on top of

E.Z. Money

.

content.description: Climb the low-angled, right leaning dihedral to the short but steep thin hand crack
content.location: About 15 or 20 ft. to the right of "H & R Block"
